data.body:
I think the parameters of the geometry generators do not fit to the description:

https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/5360a81b8c557ed255e97b87c49e7d00b546b795/examples/webgl_lights_physical.html#L221

Instead of `0.5` you would have to pass in `0.125` since it's the radius.

https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/5360a81b8c557ed255e97b87c49e7d00b546b795/examples/webgl_lights_physical.html#L228

The parameters for the box should be all `1`. Or you just omit them (since `1` is the default).

However, the example looks a bit odd with such parameters. I would do just this:
```js
var ballGeometry = new THREE.SphereBufferGeometry( 0.25, 32, 32 );
```
and change the description to:
```
Brick cube is 50 cm in size.  Globe is 50 cm in diameter.
```

@moraxy Would you like to do a PR with the change?
